item.title: BRAID: Bounded Reasoning for Autonomous Inference and Decisions
item.description: arXiv:2512.15959v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Language Models (LLMs) exhibit nonlinear relationships between performance, cost, and token usage. This paper presents a quantitative study on structured prompting using BRAID (Bounded Reasoning for Au tonomous Inference and Decisions) across mu...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> study, LLM, GPT, prompting, large language model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Surely Large Multimodal Models (Don't) Excel in Visual Species Recognition?
item.description: arXiv:2512.15748v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Visual Species Recognition (VSR) is pivotal to biodiversity assessment and conservation, evolution research, and ecology and ecosystem management. Training a machine-learned model for VSR typically requires vast amounts of annotated images. Yet, speci...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> image, prompting, example, arxiv, model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Context-Engineering - "Context engineering is the delicate art and science of filling the context window with just the right information for the next step." — Andrej Karpathy. A frontier, first-principles handbook inspired by Karpathy and 3Blue1Brown for moving beyond prompt engineering to the wider discipline of context design, orchestration, and optimization.
item.description: "Context engineering is the delicate art and science of filling the context window with just the right information for the next step." — Andrej Karpathy.
